Dear Ksi, i know you probably wont see this, but I want to inform you that a score of 57-57 and 57-56 that the judges scored this contest, is simply not possible if you do the math. I don't know how anyone have not seen this, but if both fighters won 3 rounds it would be 57-57 and as we know, Tommy got a point taken, wich means he can not end on a even score or win by one point. If he won 4 rounds -1 point he would have 58, wich means you would get 56 wich none of the judges scored it, and if he won 3 rounds -1 point he would get 56 and you would get 57. Even if you lost a round so bad you would get 8 points, the total amount of point to give would be 118, wich means a maximum score on a draw could be 56-56. So none of the three judges scored the fight correctly, wich means 3 judges gave incorrect scorecards. Either by forgetting taking a point from Tommy or just miscalculated. Just wanted you to know or maybe make a complain or demand a reevaluation.

According to YouTubeâ€™s Harmful or dangerous content policy, content that encourages dangerous or illegal activities that risk serious physical harm or death is not allowed on YouTube.   If such content is found, it will be removed and the content creator may face consequences such as:  A warning or a strike on their channel. YouTube has a three-strikes system, where repeated violations can lead to channel termination.  Demonetization or limited monetization of their videos. This means that the content creator will not be able to earn money from ads or other features on YouTube.  Loss of access to certain features or programs, such as YouTube Partner Program, YouTube Premium, or YouTube Music.  Legal action or referral to law enforcement, if the content is illegal or poses a serious threat to public safety.  Content creators who upload harmful or dangerous content may also face negative impacts on their mental and physical health, such as online abuse, depression, anxiety, body dysmorphia, or eating disorders. Therefore, it is important for content creators to follow YouTubeâ€™s Community Guidelines and respect the safety and well-being of themselves and others.

Results at the bottom, sorry if this is incorrect spelling or me using the wrong words, I'm staying up nearly 12:00am to type it out because I can see how much it might mean to him or his fans. I can understand when people work hard and don't get the results they want, but I know JJ has a lot more things to worry about then boxing, but me personally I just get up from my losses and train harder. Round 1:  Close fight but either KSI or fury could of got the round. I reckon KSI because he forced fury to the ropes more but judges could always give it to the other person because I don't know how pro boxing judges could allocate rounds ( meaning how they judge who won the round based off of certain categories; Technique, footwork, ring-craft, defence, punches landed and how the boxer controlled the fight overall).  Round 2:  I believe that KSI won the round because he landed more punches and controlled the fight more often. Tommy wasn't doing much, but punching while grappling ( same as KSI), but he wasn't able to land too many punches as KSI was coming in and out of Tommy's range (whether in the clinch or jumping in with jabs and a right-cross).  Round 3: It was a close round but I could see how judges could of given it to Tommy. Because of the fact that Tommy landed more punches then KSI (in the clinch and KSI trying to get out of the clinch or even just jabs to the face), they might not be much, but both boxers were just grabbing constantly and to be fair for the judges that's hard to score, a whole 3 minute round with very little to work with. That's why I gave KSI the first two because he threw and landed more straight punches then Tommy (being more appealing to the judges when deciding who won the round). Although Tommy did not land much on KSI, he did land more clean punches. I'm not saying KSI did not throw punches ( not having a high work rate), but the punches I saw grazed and rolled of Tommy's shoulder when watching it from the naked eye and in slow-motion.  Round 4:  I believe it was Tommy's again, simply for the fact that KSI wasn't landing clean enough punches. From the Point of view of watching  the fight on YouTube DAZN Boxing channel, both boxers were throwing punches, but I saw KSI land the less effective punches, because his body and head was given more feedback from Tommy's punches (head snapping back, body jerking from the body shots etc.), where as Tommy seems less affected by KSI's blows to the body and head in the clinch. EXPLAINED MORE IN ROUND 5  Round 5:  I'd have to give it to Tommy again, Tommy started timing KSI on the way out of the clinch, landing punches that would snap his head back. The body language a Boxer conveys is important for the judges decision, 2 people who trade straight rights - with the same power, the boxer who had his head snap back because of external factors, chin not tucked it, off-balance, what ever. Sways the judges decision for the boxer whose head didn't snap back. He would look more in control, plus landing the "cleaner" and more "powerful" punch. Making it seem like it was done on purpose as a "calculated shot" ( counterpunch, or "take one to give one").  Round 6:  I reckon it could of gone both ways ( which is how I could see how one of the judges could of scored it as a draw). I believe Tommy edged it out because KSI wasn't doing enough in the fight to convince the judges he had control of Tommy. Yes, he might of bounced around the ring and had his hands down, but judges ignore those sort of things. If either boxer is landing good, clean punches and is using their defence to counter or avoid punches getting thrown back at them then it doesn't matter. But the reason why I believe KSI didn't land enough punches to edge him the round was because, the first 75%  of the round he would back up constantly ( whether doing it straight out of a clinch or after an "out-of-range jab), and jump back in - leaning forward and falling forward, resulting in him ramming into Tommy with his head down and his arms rapped around his back to avoid getting hit when he's off balance, due to his poor choice of footwork. That or he would constantly wrap his left-arm around Tommy's back ( on his right side), and proceed to exchange nonsensical punches that are difficult for judges to see, making it difficult for judges to score. KSI's overhand was REALLY NICE, ( which is why I think it could of gone both ways), but he didn't follow up on that. If he had done a little more he would of won that round convincingly.  Conclusion: Whereas Here's how I scored it (btw the winner is declared the one with the most points and you get 10 points for winning a round and the other person 9 for losing it, in KSI's case he would of gotten a 10-8 round because Tommy lost a point for punching him in the head and because I thought KSI won the round).  Note: sometimes judges can give 10-8 round by themself if they've truly dominated a round (uncommon) or knock them down ( not uncommon).                     RD1:                                                         RD2:                                          RD3:                                  RD4:                                      RD5:                               RD6:             Total:         KSI:    +10   W                                                    +10   W                                     +9      L                             +9       L                                 +9        L                         +9        L         = 56 Tommy:     +9    L                                                      +8       L                                     +10   W                            +10     W                               +10     W                         +10     W         = 57 Sincerely hope you enjoy or read this whoever it may be, I've followed JJ for a while and I use to love his content, and it just sad for an old fan to see him like this. I've been doing Boxing for a while now and this is just my opinion.

Your corner advised you to keep clinching to try and bait tommy into hitting you in the back of the head so he would get another point deducted, frankly I can't blame you. Because you stated your game plan fighting tommy from the start, you said you weren't going to box him you were going to fight him. And frankly you were exactly right. You broke the boxing rules numerous times in an attempt to win, and made the fight so unbelievably boring to watch.  Frankly, I am disappointed in KSI's skill set and the way he boxes, it felt like ever sense the logan fight, he has regressed in boxing ability and not progressed, since he trains with MMA coaches, it appears that hes breaking boxing rules more and more as he boxes, from elbows to back of the head shots to constant clinching  And for anyone who doesn't know, constant clinching will actually decrease your performance in the judges eyes  if you and your opponent both landed 39 punches in a round, but you only got it from the clinch, your opponent wins the round. It doesn't matter if the punches are the same, fighting with a constant clinch style is shamed upon by judges and by fighters  Currently, I think JJ will not improve if he keeps having these ideas that tommy didn't beat him, because he will lose his next fight if that is how he trains  TL:DR I felt that KSI is delusional, he did not win this fight based on boxing scoring, and if he fought tommy fury with a boxing style, i think he would've gotten flatlined out cold
